papers.title: Constructive Post-Quantum Reductions
papers.authors: Nir Bitansky, Zvika Brakerski, Yael Tauman Kalai
papers.abstract: Is it possible to convert classical reductions into post-quantum ones? It is customary to argue that while this is problematic in the interactive setting, non-interactive reductions do carry over. However, when considering quantum auxiliary input, this conversion results in a non-constructive post-quantum reduction that requires duplicating the quantum auxiliary input, which is in general inefficient or even impossible. This violates the win-win premise of provable cryptography: an attack against a cryptographic primitive should lead to an algorithmic advantage. We initiate the study of constructive quantum reductions and present positive and negative results for converting large classes of classical reductions to the post-quantum setting in a constructive manner. We show that any non-interactive non-adaptive reduction from assumptions with a polynomial solution space (such as decision assumptions) can be made post-quantum constructive. In contrast, assumptions with super-polynomial solution space (such as general search assumptions) cannot be generally converted. Along the way, we make several additional contributions: 1. We put forth a framework for reductions (or general interaction) with stateful solvers for a computational problem, that may change their internal state between consecutive calls. We show that such solvers can still be utilized. This framework and our results are meaningful even in the classical setting. 2. A consequence of our negative result is that quantum auxiliary input that is useful against a problem with a super-polynomial solution space cannot be generically “restored” post-measurement. This shows that the novel rewinding technique of Chiesa et al. (FOCS 2021) is tight in the sense that it cannot be extended beyond a polynomial measurement space. ∗Tel Aviv University, Israel, nbitansky@gmail.com. papers.abstract_zh: 有没有可能将经典约化转化为后量子约化？习惯上认为，虽然这在互动环境中是有问题的，但非互动的减少确实会延续。然而，当考虑量子辅助输入时，这种转换导致需要复制量子辅助输入的非建设性的后量子减少，这通常是低效的或者甚至是不可能的。这违反了可证明密码术的双赢前提:对密码原语的攻击应该导致算法优势。我们开始了建设性量子约化的研究，并以建设性的方式提出了将大类经典约化转换到后量子环境的正反结果。我们证明了从具有多项式解空间的假设(例如决策假设)的任何非交互非自适应约简都可以是后量子建设性的。相比之下，具有超多项式解空间的假设(如一般搜索假设)一般不能转换。在这个过程中，我们还做了几个额外的贡献:1 .我们为一个计算问题提出了一个与有状态解算器进行约简(或一般交互)的框架，这可能会在连续调用之间改变它们的内部状态。我们证明了这样的解算器仍然可以被利用。这个框架和我们的结果即使在经典环境中也是有意义的。2.我们的否定结果的一个结果是，对于具有超多项式解空间的问题有用的量子辅助输入一般不能在测量后“恢复”。这表明Chiesa等人(FOCS 2021)的新颖的重绕技术在不能扩展到多项式测量空间之外的意义上是严格的。* nbitansky@gmail.com特拉维夫大学。信息安全检查点协会成员。由神道国际学会赠款18/484和19/2137、莱恩·布拉瓦特尼克和Blavatnik家庭基金会、特拉维夫大学Blavatnik跨学科网络研究中心和欧洲联盟地平线2020研究和创新方案通过ERC项目REACT(赠款756482)支持。以色列魏茨曼科学研究所，zvika.brakerski@weizmann.ac.il。由以色列科学基金会(赠款号3426/21)和欧盟地平线2020研究和创新计划通过ERC项目REACT(赠款号756482)和普罗米修斯项目(赠款号780701)资助。微软研究院和麻省理工学院，美国马萨诸塞州，yael@microsoft.com。这份材料基于DARPA根据HR001120200号协议支持的工作。本材料中表达的任何意见、发现和结论或建议都是作者的，不一定反映美国政府或DARPA的观点。ar X iv :2 20 3。2002年2月31日

papers.title: Succinct Classical Verification of Quantum Computation
papers.authors: James Bartusek, Yael Tauman Kalai, Alex Lombardi, Fermi Ma, Giulio Malavolta, Vinod Vaikuntanathan, Thomas Vidick, Lisa Yang
papers.abstract: We construct a classically verifiable succinct interactive argument for quantum computation (BQP) with communication complexity and verifier runtime that are poly-logarithmic in the runtime of the BQP computation (and polynomial in the security parameter). Our protocol is secure assuming the post-quantum security of indistinguishability obfuscation (iO) and Learning with Errors (LWE). This is the first succinct argument for quantum computation in the plain model ; prior work (Chia-Chung-Yamakawa, TCC ’20) requires both a long common reference string and non-black-box use of a hash function modeled as a random oracle. At a technical level, we revisit the framework for constructing classically verifiable quantum computation (Mahadev, FOCS ’18). We give a self-contained, modular proof of security for Mahadev’s protocol, which we believe is of independent interest. Our proof readily generalizes to a setting in which the verifier’s first message (which consists of many public keys) is compressed. Next, we formalize this notion of compressed public keys; we view the object as a generalization of constrained/programmable PRFs and instantiate it based on indistinguishability obfuscation. Finally, we compile the above protocol into a fully succinct argument using a (sufficiently composable) succinct argument of knowledge for NP. Using our framework, we achieve several additional results, including • Succinct arguments for QMA (given multiple copies of the witness), • Succinct non-interactive arguments for BQP (or QMA) in the quantum random oracle model, and • Succinct batch arguments for BQP (or QMA) assuming post-quantum LWE (without iO). papers.abstract_zh: 我们为量子计算(BQP)构造了一个经典的可验证的简洁交互论证，其通信复杂度和验证器运行时间在BQP计算的运行时间中是多对数的(在安全参数中是多项式的)。我们的协议是安全的，假设后量子安全性的不可区分性混淆(iO)和错误学习(LWE)。这是简单模型中量子计算的第一个简洁论证；先前的工作(Chia-Chung-Yamakawa，TCC '20)需要一个长的公共引用字符串和作为随机预言模型的散列函数的非黑盒使用。在技术层面上，我们重新审视了构建经典可验证量子计算的框架(Mahadev，FOCS 18)。对于Mahadev的协议，我们给出了一个自包含的、模块化的安全性证明，我们认为这是独立的。我们的证明很容易推广到验证者的第一条消息(由许多公钥组成)被压缩的情况。接下来，我们将压缩公钥的概念形式化；我们将该对象视为受约束/可编程PRFs的一般化，并基于不可区分性混淆对其进行实例化。最后，我们使用NP知识的(足够可组合的)简洁论证将上述协议编译成完全简洁的论证。使用我们的框架，我们获得了几个额外的结果，包括:“QMA”的简洁论证(给出了证人的多个副本),“量子随机预言模型”中“BQP ”(或“QMA ”)的简洁非交互论证，以及,“BQP ”(或“QMA ”)假设后量子LWE(没有iO)的简洁批量论证。加州大学伯克利分校。电子邮件:bartusek.james@gmail.com。微软研究院和麻省理工学院。电子邮件:yael@microsoft.com。麻省理工学院。电子邮件:alexjl@mit.edu。西蒙斯研究所和加州大学伯克利分校。电子邮件:fermima@alum.mit.edu。马克斯& # 183；普朗克安全与隐私研究所。邮箱:Giulio . mala volta @ hotmail . it . papers.title_zh: 量子计算的简洁经典验证

papers.title: On the Feasibility of Unclonable Encryption, and More
papers.authors: Prabhanjan Ananth, Fatih Kaleoglu, Xingjian Li, Qipeng Liu, Mark Zhandry
papers.abstract: Unclonable encryption, ﬁrst introduced by Broadbent and Lord (TQC’20), is a one-time encryption scheme with the following security guarantee: any non-local adversary ( 𝒜 , ℬ , 𝒞 ) cannot simultaneously distinguish encryptions of two equal length messages. This notion is termed as unclonable indistinguishability. Prior works focused on achieving a weaker notion of unclonable encryption, where we required that any non-local adversary ( 𝒜 , ℬ , 𝒞 ) cannot simultaneously recover the entire message 𝑚 . Seemingly innocuous, understanding the feasibility of encryption schemes satisfying unclonable indistinguishability (even for 1-bit messages) has remained elusive. We make progress towards establishing the feasibility of unclonable encryption.
papers.abstract_zh: 不可克隆加密首先由Broadbent和Lord (TQC'20)提出，是一种一次性加密方案，具有以下安全保证:任何非本地对手(𝒜、ℬ、𝒞)不能同时区分两个等长消息的加密。这个概念被称为不可克隆的不可区分性。先前的工作集中于实现不可克隆加密的较弱概念，其中我们要求任何非本地对手(𝒜、ℬ、𝒞)不能同时恢复整个消息𝑚。理解满足不可克隆的不可区分性(即使对于1比特的消息)的加密方案的可行性似乎无关紧要，但仍然难以捉摸。我们在建立不可克隆加密的可行性方面取得了进展。

papers.title: Incompressible Encodings

papers.abstract: In this note we study the limitations of incompressible encodings with information-theoretic security. We demonstrate a flaw in the existing proof of the impossibility of constructing incompressible encodings information-theoretically. Our main contribution is a full proof of impossibility of existence of non-trivial information-theoretically secure incompressible encoding schemes.
papers.abstract_zh: 在这篇文章中，我们研究了不可压缩编码在信息论安全性方面的局限性。我们从理论上证明了构造不可压缩编码信息的不可能性的现有证明中的一个缺陷。我们的主要贡献是充分证明了非平凡信息的不可能性——理论上安全的不可压缩编码方案。

papers.title: Cryptanalysis Results on Spook - Bringing Full-Round Shadow-512 to the Light
papers.authors: Patrick Derbez, Paul Huynh, Virginie Lallemand, María Naya-Plasencia, Léo Perrin, André Schrottenloher
papers.abstract: . Spook [BBB + 19] is one of the 32 candidates that has made it to the second round of the NIST Lightweight Cryptography Standardization process, and is particularly interesting since it proposes differential side channel resistance. In this paper, we present practical distinguishers of the full 6-step version of the underlying permutations of Spook , namely Shadow-512 and Shadow-384 , solving challenges proposed by the designers on the permutation. We also propose practical forgeries with 4-step Shadow for the S1P mode of operation in the nonce misuse sce-nario, which is allowed by the CIML2 security game considered by the authors. All the results presented in this paper have been implemented.
papers.abstract_zh: 。Spook [BBB + 19]是已经进入NIST轻量级加密标准过程第二轮的32个候选之一，并且特别有趣，因为它提出了差分侧信道阻力。在本文中，我们提出了Spook的底层排列的完整6步版本的实用区分器，即Shadow-512和Shadow-384，解决了设计者对排列提出的挑战。我们还提出了在当前误用情况下S1P操作模式的4步阴影的实际伪造，这是作者考虑的CIML2安全游戏所允许的。本文给出的所有结果都已实现。

papers.title: Alzette: A 64-Bit ARX-box - (Feat. CRAX and TRAX)
papers.authors: Christof Beierle, Alex Biryukov, Luan Cardoso dos Santos, Johann Großschädl, Léo Perrin, Aleksei Udovenko, Vesselin Velichkov, Qingju Wang
papers.abstract: , Abstract. S-boxes are the only source of non-linearity in many symmetric primitives. While they are often deﬁned as being functions operating on a small space, some recent designs propose the use of much larger ones (e.g., 32 bits). In this context, an S-box is then deﬁned as a subfunction whose cryptographic properties can be estimated precisely. We present a 64-bit ARX-based S-box called Alzette , which can be evaluated in constant time using only 12 instructions on modern CPUs. Its parallel application can also leverage vector (SIMD) instructions. One iteration of Alzette has diﬀerential and linear properties comparable to those of the AES S-box, and two are at least as secure as the AES super S-box. As the state size is much larger than the typical 4 or 8 bits, the study of the relevant cryptographic properties of Alzette is not trivial. We further discuss how such wide S-boxes could be used to construct round functions of 64-, 128- and 256-bit (tweakable) block ciphers with good cryptographic properties that are guaranteed even in the related-tweak setting. We use these structures to design a very lightweight 64-bit block cipher ( Crax ) which outperforms SPECK-64/128 for short messages on micro-controllers, and a 256-bit tweakable block cipher ( Trax ) which can be used to obtain strong security guarantees against powerful adversaries (nonce misuse, quantum attacks).
papers.abstract_zh: ，抽象。s盒是许多对称原语中非线性的唯一来源。虽然它们通常被定义为在小空间上运行的功能，但最近的一些设计建议使用大得多的功能(例如32位)。在这种情况下，S盒被定义为一个子函数，其密码特性可以精确估计。我们提出了一个基于ARX的64位S盒，称为Alzette，它可以在现代CPU上仅使用12条指令在恒定时间内进行评估。它的并行应用也可以利用矢量(SIMD)指令。Alzette的一次迭代具有与AES S-box相当的diﬀerential和线性属性，两次迭代至少与AES super S-box一样安全。由于状态大小远大于典型的4或8位，因此对Alzette的相关密码特性的研究并不简单。我们进一步讨论了如何使用这样的宽S盒来构造64位、128位和256位(可调)分组密码的轮函数，这些分组密码具有良好的密码特性，即使在相关的可调设置中也能保证这些特性。我们使用这些结构设计了一个非常轻量级的64位分组密码(Crax ),它在微控制器上的短消息方面优于SPECK-64/128，还设计了一个256位可调分组密码(Trax ),它可以用来针对强大的对手(nonce误用，量子攻击)获得强大的安全保证。

papers.title: A Black-Box Approach to Post-Quantum Zero-Knowledge in Constant Rounds
papers.authors: Nai-Hui Chia, Kai-Min Chung, Takashi Yamakawa
papers.abstract:
We obtain the first constant-round post-quantum multi-party computation protocol for general classical functionalities in the plain model, with security against malicious corruptions. We assume mildly super-polynomial quantum hardness of learning with errors (LWE), and quantum polynomial hardness of an LWE-based circular security assumption. Along the way, we also construct the following protocols that may be of independent interest. 
(1) Constant-round zero-knowledge against parallel quantum verifiers from quantum polynomial assumptions. 
Here, we develop a novel parallel no-cloning non-black-box simulation technique. This uses as a starting point the recently introduced no-cloning technique of Bitansky and Shmueli (STOC 2020) and Ananth and La Placa (ePrint 2019), which in turns builds on the classical non-black-box technique of Bitansky, Khurana and Paneth (STOC 2019). Our approach relies on a new technical tool, spooky encryption for relations computable by quantum circuits, that we also construct. 
(2) Constant-round post-quantum non-malleable commitments from mildly super-polynomial quantum hardness of LWE. 
This is the first construction of post-quantum non-malleable commitments in the plain model, and is obtained by transforming the construction of Khurana and Sahai (FOCS 2017) to obtain post-quantum security. 
We achieve quantum security by building a new straight-line non-black-box simulator against parallel verifiers that does not clone the adversary's state. This technique may also be relevant to the classical setting.
papers.abstract_zh:
在简单模型下，我们得到了第一个针对一般经典功能的常数轮后量子多方计算协议，该协议具有防止恶意破坏的安全性。我们假设带有错误的学习(LWE)的适度超多项式量子硬度，以及基于LWE的循环安全假设的量子多项式硬度。在此过程中，我们还构建了以下可能独立感兴趣的协议。
(1)针对来自量子多项式假设的并行量子验证器的恒定轮零知识。
在这里，我们开发了一种新的并行非克隆非黑盒模拟技术。这使用了最近引入的Bitansky和Shmueli (STOC 2020年)以及Ananth和La Placa (ePrint 2019年)的非克隆技术作为起点，该技术又建立在Bitansky、Khurana和Paneth (STOC 2019年)的经典非黑盒技术的基础上。我们的方法依赖于一种新的技术工具，量子电路可计算关系的幽灵加密，这也是我们构建的。
(2)LWE适度超多项式量子硬度的恒圆后量子不可展性承诺。
这是plain模型中第一个后量子不可延展承诺的构造，通过变换Khurana和Sahai (FOCS 2017)的构造获得后量子安全性。
我们通过建立一个新的直线非黑盒模拟器来对抗并行验证器来实现量子安全，它不会克隆对手的状态。这种技术也可能与古典环境有关。

papers.title: No Time to Hash: On Super-Efficient Entropy Accumulation
papers.authors: Yevgeniy Dodis, Siyao Guo, Noah Stephens-Davidowitz, Zhiye Xie
papers.abstract: Real-world random number generators (RNGs) cannot aﬀord to use (slow) cryptographic hashing every time they refresh their state R with a new entropic input X . Instead, they use “supereﬃcient” simple entropy-accumulation procedures, such as R ← rot α,n ( R ) ⊕ X, where rot α,n rotates an n -bit state R by some ﬁxed number α . For example, Microsoft’s RNG uses α = 5 for n = 32 and α = 19 for n = 64. Where do these numbers come from? Are they good choices? Should rotation be replaced by a better permutation π of the input bits? In this work we initiate a rigorous study of these pragmatic questions, by modeling the sequence of successive entropic inputs X 1 , X 2 , . . . as independent (but otherwise adversarial) samples from some natural distribution family D . Our contribution is as follows.

papers.title: Highly Efficient Key Exchange Protocols with Optimal Tightness
papers.authors: Katriel Cohn-Gordon, Cas Cremers, Kristian Gjøsteen, Håkon Jacobsen, Tibor Jager
papers.abstract: . In this paper we give nearly-tight reductions for modern implicitly authenticated Diﬃe-Hellman protocols in the style of the Signal and Noise protocols, which are extremely simple and eﬃcient. Unlike previous approaches, the combination of nearly-tight proofs and eﬃcient protocols enables the ﬁrst real-world instantiations for which the parameters can be chosen in a theoretically sound manner. Our reductions have only a linear loss in the number of users, implying that our protocols are more eﬃcient than the state of the art when instantiated with theoretically sound parameters. We also prove that our security proofs are optimal: a linear loss in the number of users is unavoidable for our protocols for a large and natural class of reductions.
papers.abstract_zh: 。在本文中，我们以信号和噪声协议的形式给出了现代隐式认证Diﬃe-Hellman协议的近紧约简，这些协议非常简单并且是eﬃcient.与以前的方法不同，近乎严密的证明和eﬃcient协议的结合实现了第一个真实世界的实例化，可以以理论上合理的方式为其选择参数。我们的减少在用户数量上只有线性损失，这意味着当用理论上合理的参数实例化时，我们的协议比现有技术更eﬃcient。我们还证明了我们的安全性证明是最优的:对于我们的协议来说，用户数量的线性损失是不可避免的。

papers.title: Bloom Filters in Adversarial Environments
papers.authors: Moni Naor, Eylon Yogev
papers.abstract: Many efficient data structures use randomness, allowing them to improve upon deterministic ones. Usually, their efficiency and correctness are analyzed using probabilistic tools under the assumption that the inputs and queries are independent of the internal randomness of the data structure. In this work, we consider data structures in a more robust model, which we call the adversarial model. Roughly speaking, this model allows an adversary to choose inputs and queries adaptively according to previous responses. Specifically, we consider a data structure known as a “Bloom filter” and prove a tight connection between Bloom filters in this model and cryptography. A Bloom filter represents a set S of elements approximately by using fewer bits than a precise representation. The price for succinctness is allowing for some errors: For any x ∈ S, it should always answer Yes, and for any x ∉ S it should answer Yes only with small probability. In the adversarial model, we consider both efficient adversaries (that run in polynomial time) and computationally unbounded adversaries that are only bounded in the number of queries they can make. For computationally bounded adversaries, we show that non-trivial (memory-wise) Bloom filters exist if and only if one-way functions exist. For unbounded adversaries, we show that there exists a Bloom filter for sets of size n and error ε that is secure against t queries and uses only O(n log 1/ε + t) bits of memory. In comparison, n log 1/ε is the best possible under a non-adaptive adversary.
papers.abstract_zh: 许多有效的数据结构使用随机性，允许它们在确定性的基础上进行改进。通常，在假设输入和查询与数据结构的内部随机性无关的情况下，使用概率工具来分析它们的效率和正确性。在这项工作中，我们考虑一个更健壮的模型中的数据结构，我们称之为对抗模型。粗略地说，该模型允许对手根据先前的响应自适应地选择输入和查询。具体来说，我们考虑一种称为“Bloom filter”的数据结构，并证明了该模型中的Bloom filter与密码学之间的紧密联系。布隆过滤器通过使用比精确表示更少的比特来近似表示元素的集合S。简洁的代价是允许一些错误:对于任何x ∈ S，它应该总是回答是，对于任何x ∉，它应该只以很小的概率回答是。在对抗模型中，我们考虑了有效的对手(在多项式时间内运行)和计算上无限制的对手，这些对手只受限于他们可以进行的查询的数量。对于计算受限的对手，我们证明了当且仅当单向函数存在时，非平凡(内存方面)布隆过滤器存在。对于无界的对手，我们证明了存在一个Bloom filter，其大小为n，误差为ε，对t个查询是安全的，并且只使用O(n log 1/ε + t)比特的内存。相比之下，在非适应性对手下，n log 1/ε可能是最好的。

papers.title: Yet Another Compiler for Active Security or: Efficient MPC Over Arbitrary Rings
papers.authors: Ivan Damgård, Claudio Orlandi, Mark Simkin
papers.abstract: This is the scientific report for the paper entitled “Yet Another Compiler for Active Security or: Efficient MPC Over Arbitrary Rings”. This research produces a powerful idea for transforming any semi-honestly secure multiparty computation (MPC) into an actively secure protocol while taking into consideration reducing the threshold of tolerance corruption for real parties by semi-honest adversaries. An efficient compiler has introduced a new multiparty computation protocol for the important case of secure evaluation of arithmetic circuits over arbitrary rings (we show three parties). The first protocol for secure computation over arbitrary rings that achieves active security with constant overhead is produced in this research.
papers.abstract_zh: 这是一篇题为“又一个主动安全编译器或:任意环上的高效MPC”的论文的科学报告。这项研究为将任何半诚实安全多方计算(MPC)转化为主动安全协议提供了一个强有力的思路，同时考虑到降低半诚实对手对真实方的容忍破坏阈值。一个高效的编译器已经引入了一个新的多方计算协议，用于任意环上算术电路的安全评估的重要情况(我们显示了三方)。本研究提出了第一个在任意环上实现主动安全的安全计算协议。
papers.title_zh: 又一个主动安全编译器:任意环上的高效MPC

papers.title: Improved Division Property Based Cube Attacks Exploiting Algebraic Properties of Superpoly
papers.authors: Qingju Wang, Yonglin Hao, Yosuke Todo, Chaoyun Li, Takanori Isobe, Willi Meier
papers.abstract: At CRYPTO 2017 and IEEE Transactions on Computers in 2018, Todo et al. proposed the division property based cube attack method making it possible to launch cube attacks with cubes of dimensions far beyond practical reach. However, assumptions are made to validate their attacks. In this paper, we further formulate the algebraic properties of the superpoly in one framework to facilitate cube attacks in more successful applications: we propose the “flag” technique to enhance the precision of MILP models, which enable us to identify proper non-cube IV assignments; a degree evaluation algorithm is presented to upper bound the degree of the superpoly s.t. the superpoly can be recovered without constructing its whole truth table and overall complexity of the attack can be largely reduced; we provide a divide-and-conquer strategy to Trivium-like stream ciphers namely Trivium, Kreyvium, TriviA-SC1/2 so that the large scale MILP models can be split into several small solvable ones enabling us to analyze Trivium-like primitives with more than 1000 initialization rounds; finally, we provide a term enumeration algorithm for finding the monomials of the superpoly, so that the complexity of many attacks can be further reduced. We apply our techniques to attack the initialization of several ciphers namely 839-round Trivium, 891-round Kreyvium, 1009-round TriviA-SC1, 1004-round TriviA-SC2, 184-round Grain-128a and 750-round Acorn respectively.
papers.abstract_zh: 在2017年的CRYPTO 2017和2018年的IEEE Transactions on Computers上，Todo等人提出了基于division property的立方体攻击方法，使得使用维度远远超出实际范围的立方体发动立方体攻击成为可能。然而，假设被用来验证他们的攻击。在本文中，我们在一个框架中进一步阐述了superpoly的代数性质，以便在更成功的应用中促进立方体攻击:我们提出了“标记”技术来提高MILP模型的精度，这使我们能够识别适当的非立方体IV赋值；提出了一种度评估算法来对超策略的度进行上界。超策略可以在不构建其完整真值表的情况下被恢复，从而大大降低了攻击的总体复杂度；我们对Trivium类流密码即Trivium，Kreyvium，TriviA-SC1/2提供了一种分治策略，使得大规模的MILP模型可以分成几个小的可解模型，使我们能够用超过1000轮的初始化来分析Trivium类原语；最后，我们提供了一个寻找超poly的单项式的项枚举算法，这样可以进一步降低许多攻击的复杂度。我们应用我们的技术分别攻击了几个密码的初始化，即839轮Trivium，891轮Kreyvium，1009轮TriviA-SC1，1004轮TriviA-SC2，184轮Grain-128a和750轮Acorn。
papers.title_zh: 利用超多边形代数性质的改进除法性质的立方体攻击

2016.conf_title: 36th CRYPTO 2016: Santa Barbara, CA, USA - Part III

papers.title: Quantum Homomorphic Encryption for Polynomial-Sized Circuits
papers.authors: Yfke Dulek, Christian Schaffner, Florian Speelman
papers.abstract:
We present a new scheme for quantum homomorphic encryption which is compact and allows for efficient evaluation of arbitrary polynomial-sized quantum circuits. Building on the framework of Broadbent and Jeffery and recent results in the area of instantaneous non-local quantum computation, we show how to construct quantum gadgets that allow perfect correction of the errors which occur during the homomorphic evaluation of T gates on encrypted quantum data. Our scheme can be based on any classical (leveled) fully homomorphic encryption (FHE) scheme and requires no computational assumptions besides those already used by the classical scheme. The size of our quantum gadget depends on the space complexity of the classical decryption function -- which aligns well with the current efforts to minimize the complexity of the decryption function. 
Our scheme (or slight variants of it) offers a number of additional advantages such as ideal compactness, the ability to supply gadgets "on demand", circuit privacy for the evaluator against passive adversaries, and a three-round scheme for blind delegated quantum computation which puts only very limited demands on the quantum abilities of the client.
papers.abstract_zh:
我们提出了一种新的量子同态加密方案，该方案是紧凑的，可以有效评估任意多项式量子电路。 在Broadbent和Jeffery的框架内，以及瞬时非本地量子计算区域的最新结果，我们展示了如何构建量子小工具，这些小工具可以完美校正在加密量子数据上对T门的同型评估期间发生的错误。 我们的方案可以基于任何经典的（平整）完全同态加密（FHE）方案，除了经典方案已经使用的那些外，不需要计算假设。 我们的量子小工具的大小取决于经典解密函数的空间复杂性 - 这与当前为最大程度地减少解密函数的复杂性所做的努力很好。 
 我们的方案（或略有变体）提供了许多其他优势，例如理想的紧凑性，“按需”提供小工具的能力，评估者的电路隐私对被动对手的私密性以及盲目授权量子计算的三轮方案 这只对客户的量子能力的需求非常有限。
papers.title_zh: 多项式规模电路的量子同态加密

papers.title: How to Recover a Secret with O(n) Additions
papers.authors: Benny Applebaum, Oded Nir, Benny Pinkas
papers.abstract: Threshold cryptography is typically based on the idea of secret-sharing a private-key s ∈ F “in the exponent” of some cryptographic group G , or more generally, encoding s in some linearly homomorphic domain. In each invocation of the threshold system (e.g., for signing or decrypting) an “encoding” of the secret is being recovered and so the complexity, measured as the number of group multiplications over G , is equal to the number of F -additions that are needed to reconstruct the secret. Motivated by this scenario, we initiate the study of n -party secret-sharing schemes whose reconstruction algorithm makes a minimal number of additions . The complexity of existing schemes either scales linearly with n log | F | (e.g., Shamir, CACM’79) or, at least, quadratically with n independently of the size of the domain F (e.g., Cramer-Xing, EUROCRYPT ’20). This leaves open the existence of a secret sharing whose recovery algorithm can be computed by performing only O ( n ) additions. We resolve the question in the afﬁrmative and present such a near-threshold secret sharing scheme that provides privacy against unauthorized sets of density at most τ p , and correctness for authorized sets of density at least τ c , for any given arbitrarily close constants τ p < τ c . Reconstruction can be computed by making at most O ( n ) additions and, in addition, (1) the share size is constant, (2) the sharing procedure
papers.title_zh: 如何用O(n)加法恢复秘密
papers.abstract_zh: 门限密码术通常基于秘密共享某个密码组G的“指数”中的私钥s ∈ F的思想，或者更一般地，在某个线性同态域中编码s。在阈值系统的每次调用中(例如，为了签名或解密),秘密的“编码”被恢复，因此复杂度(作为G上的群乘法的数量来测量)等于重构秘密所需的F-加法的数量。在这种情况的激励下，我们开始研究n方秘密共享方案，其重构算法的加法次数最少。现有方案的复杂度或者与n log | F |成线性比例(例如，沙米尔，CACM'79)，或者至少与n成二次比例，而与域F的大小无关(例如，克莱姆-兴，EUROCRYPT '20)。这使得秘密共享的存在成为可能，其恢复算法可以通过仅执行O ( n)次加法来计算。我们解决了格式中的问题，并提出了这样一种近阈值秘密共享方案，对于任何给定的任意接近常数τ p < τ c，该方案针对最多τ p的未授权密度集提供私密性，对于至少τ c的授权密度集提供正确性。重构可以通过进行最多O ( n)次加法来计算，此外，(1)共享大小是常数，(2)共享过程

papers.title: Black-Hole Radiation Decoding Is Quantum Cryptography
papers.authors: Zvika Brakerski
papers.abstract: We propose to study equivalence relations between phenomena in high-energy physics and the existence of standard cryptographic primitives, and show the first example where such an equivalence holds. A small number of prior works showed that high-energy phenomena can be explained by cryptographic hardness. Examples include using the existence of one-way functions to explain the hardness of decoding black-hole Hawking radiation (Harlow and Hayden 2013, Aaronson 2016), and using pseudorandom quantum states to explain the hardness of computing AdS/CFT dictionary (Bouland, Fefferman and Vazirani, 2020). In this work we show, for the former example of black-hole radiation decoding, that it also implies the existence of secure quantum cryptography. In fact, we show an existential equivalence between the hardness of black-hole radiation decoding and a variety of cryptographic primitives, including bit-commitment schemes and oblivious transfer protocols (using quantum communication). This can be viewed (with proper disclaimers, as we discuss) as providing a physical justification for the existence of secure cryptography. We conjecture that such connections may be found in other high-energy physics phenomena.
papers.title_zh: 黑洞辐射解码是量子密码术
papers.abstract_zh: 我们打算研究高能物理中的现象和标准密码原语的存在之间的等价关系，并展示这种等价成立的第一个例子。少量先前的工作表明高能现象可以用密码硬度来解释。例子包括利用单向函数的存在解释解码黑洞霍金辐射的难度(Harlow和Hayden 2013，Aaronson 2016)，利用伪随机量子态解释计算AdS/CFT字典的难度(Bouland，Fefferman和Vazirani，2020)。在这项工作中，我们表明，对于黑洞辐射解码的前一个例子，它也意味着安全量子密码术的存在。事实上，我们展示了黑洞辐射解码的难度与各种密码原语之间的存在等价性，包括比特承诺方案和不经意传输协议(使用量子通信)。这可以被视为(如我们所讨论的，带有适当的免责声明)为安全密码术的存在提供了物理证明。我们推测在其他高能物理现象中也可能发现这样的联系。

papers.title: Cloning Games: A General Framework for Unclonable Primitives
papers.authors: Prabhanjan Ananth, Fatih Kaleoglu, Qipeng Liu
papers.abstract: The powerful no-cloning principle of quantum mechanics can be leveraged to achieve interesting primitives, referred to as unclonable primitives, that are impossible to achieve classically. In the past few years, we have witnessed a surge of new unclonable primitives. While prior works have mainly focused on establishing feasibility results, another equally important direction, that of understanding the relationship between different unclonable primitives is still in its nascent stages. Moving forward, we need a more systematic study of unclonable primitives. To this end, we introduce a new framework called cloning games. This framework captures many fundamental unclonable primitives such as quantum money, copy-protection, unclonable encryption, single-decryptor encryption, and many more. By reasoning about different types of cloning games, we obtain many interesting implications to unclonable cryptography, including the following: 1. We obtain the first construction of information-theoretically secure single-decryptor encryption in the one-time setting. 2. We construct unclonable encryption in the quantum random oracle model based on BB84 states, improving upon the previous work, which used coset states. Our work also provides a simpler security proof for the previous work. 3. We construct copy-protection for single-bit point functions in the quantum random oracle model based on BB84 states, improving upon the previous work, which used coset states, and additionally, providing a simpler proof. 4. We establish a relationship between different challenge distributions of copy-protection schemes and single-decryptor encryption schemes. 5. Finally, we present a new construction of one-time encryption with certified deletion.
papers.title_zh: 克隆游戏:不可克隆原语的通用框架
papers.abstract_zh: 可以利用量子力学强大的不可克隆原理来实现有趣的原语，称为不可克隆原语，这是经典无法实现的。在过去的几年里，我们目睹了新的不可克隆的原语的激增。虽然先前的工作主要集中在建立可行性结果上，但是另一个同样重要的方向，即理解不同的不可克隆原语之间的关系仍处于萌芽阶段。向前看，我们需要对不可克隆的原语进行更系统的研究。为此，我们引入了一个叫做克隆游戏的新框架。这个框架捕获了许多基本的不可克隆原语，如量子货币、复制保护、不可克隆加密、单解密器加密等等。通过对不同类型的克隆游戏的推理，我们得到了许多关于不可克隆密码学的有趣的启示，包括以下几点:1 .我们得到了第一个一次性信息理论安全单解密器加密的构造。2.我们基于BB84态在量子随机预言模型中构造了不可克隆加密，改进了以前使用陪集态的工作。我们的工作也为以前的工作提供了一个更简单的安全性证明。3.我们在量子随机预言模型中基于BB84态构造了单比特点函数的复制保护，改进了以前使用陪集态的工作，并且提供了一个更简单的证明。4.我们建立了复制保护方案和单解密器加密方案的不同挑战分布之间的关系。5.最后，我们提出了一种新的具有认证删除的一次性加密构造。

papers.title: Publicly-Verifiable Deletion via Target-Collapsing Functions
papers.authors: James Bartusek, Dakshita Khurana, Alexander Poremba
papers.abstract: We build quantum cryptosystems that support publicly-verifiable deletion from standard cryptographic assumptions. We introduce target-collapsing as a weakening of collapsing for hash functions, analogous to how second preimage resistance weakens collision resistance; that is, target-collapsing requires indistinguishability between superpositions and mixtures of preimages of an honestly sampled image. We show that target-collapsing hashes enable publicly-verifiable deletion (PVD), proving conjectures from [Poremba, ITCS'23] and demonstrating that the Dual-Regev encryption (and corresponding fully homomorphic encryption) schemes support PVD under the LWE assumption. We further build on this framework to obtain a variety of primitives supporting publicly-verifiable deletion from weak cryptographic assumptions, including: - Commitments with PVD assuming the existence of injective one-way functions, or more generally, almost-regular one-way functions. Along the way, we demonstrate that (variants of) target-collapsing hashes can be built from almost-regular one-way functions. - Public-key encryption with PVD assuming trapdoored variants of injective (or almost-regular) one-way functions. We also demonstrate that the encryption scheme of [Hhan, Morimae, and Yamakawa, Eurocrypt'23] based on pseudorandom group actions has PVD. - $X$ with PVD for $X \in \{$attribute-based encryption, quantum fully-homomorphic encryption, witness encryption, time-revocable encryption$\}$, assuming $X$ and trapdoored variants of injective (or almost-regular) one-way functions.
papers.title_zh: 经由目标折叠函数的可公开验证的删除
papers.abstract_zh: 我们建立量子密码系统，支持从标准密码假设公开可验证的删除。我们引入目标折叠作为散列函数折叠的减弱，类似于第二原像阻力如何减弱碰撞阻力；也就是说，目标折叠要求不能区分真实采样图像的叠加图像和混合图像。我们证明了目标折叠散列允许可公开验证的删除(PVD)，证明了来自[Poremba，ITCS'23]的猜想，并证明了在LWE假设下，双Regev加密(和相应的全同态加密)方案支持PVD。我们进一步在这个框架上构建，以从弱密码假设中获得支持公开可验证删除的各种原语，包括:-与PVD的承诺，假设存在内射单向函数，或者更一般地，几乎正则单向函数。在此过程中，我们证明了目标折叠散列(的变体)可以从几乎常规的单向函数中构建。-使用PVD的公钥加密，假设内射(或几乎正则)单向函数的陷门变量。我们还证明了[Hhan，Morimae，and Yamakawa，Eurocrypt'23]基于伪随机群作用的加密方案具有PVD。- $X$与$X的PVD \ { $基于属性的加密，量子全同态加密，见证加密，时间可撤销加密$\}$，假设$X$和内射(或几乎正则)单向函数的陷门变体。

papers.title: Cryptography with Certified Deletion
papers.authors: James Bartusek, Dakshita Khurana
papers.abstract: We propose a new, unifying framework that yields an array of cryptographic primitives with certified deletion. These primitives enable a party in possession of a quantum ciphertext to generate a classical certificate that the encrypted plaintext has been information-theoretically deleted, and cannot be recovered even given unbounded computational resources. - For X \in {public-key, attribute-based, fully-homomorphic, witness, timed-release}, our compiler converts any (post-quantum) X encryption to X encryption with certified deletion. In addition, we compile statistically-binding commitments to statistically-binding commitments with certified everlasting hiding. As a corollary, we also obtain statistically-sound zero-knowledge proofs for QMA with certified everlasting zero-knowledge assuming statistically-binding commitments. - We also obtain a strong form of everlasting security for two-party and multi-party computation in the dishonest majority setting. While simultaneously achieving everlasting security against all parties in this setting is known to be impossible, we introduce everlasting security transfer (EST). This enables any one party (or a subset of parties) to dynamically and certifiably information-theoretically delete other participants' data after protocol execution. We construct general-purpose secure computation with EST assuming statistically-binding commitments, which can be based on one-way functions or pseudorandom quantum states. We obtain our results by developing a novel proof technique to argue that a bit b has been information-theoretically deleted from an adversary's view once they output a valid deletion certificate, despite having been previously information-theoretically determined by the ciphertext they held in their view. This technique may be of independent interest.
papers.title_zh: 认证删除密码术
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了一个新的，统一的框架，产生了一系列的密码原语与认证删除。这些原语使拥有量子密文的一方能够生成经典证书，证明加密的明文已经被信息理论上删除，并且即使给定无限的计算资源也无法恢复。-对于X \in {public-key，attribute-based，fully-homomorphic，witness，timed-release}，我们的编译器将任何(后量子)X加密转换为具有认证删除的X加密。此外，我们编制了统计约束承诺，以统计约束承诺与认证的永久隐藏。作为推论，我们还获得了统计上合理的零知识证明，证明了假设统计约束承诺下QMA具有永久的零知识。-我们还获得了在不诚实多数环境下两方和多方计算的持久安全的强形式。虽然在这种环境中同时实现对所有各方的永久安全是不可能的，但我们引入了永久安全转移(EST)。这使得任何一方(或各方的子集)能够在协议执行之后动态地并且可证明地从信息理论上删除其他参与者的数据。我们用EST构造通用安全计算，假设统计约束承诺，它可以基于单向函数或伪随机量子态。我们通过开发一种新的证明技术来证明位b已经是信息——理论上，一旦对手输出有效的删除证书，该位b就已经从对手的观点中被删除了，尽管该位b先前已经是信息——理论上是由他们的观点中持有的密文来确定的。这项技术可能是独立的利益。

papers.title: Secure Computation with Shared EPR Pairs (Or: How to Teleport in Zero-Knowledge)
papers.authors: James Bartusek, Dakshita Khurana, Akshayaram Srinivasan
papers.abstract: Can a sender non-interactively transmit one of two strings to a receiver without knowing which string was received? Does there exist minimally-interactive secure multiparty computation that only makes (black-box) use of symmetric-key primitives? We provide affirmative answers to these questions in a model where parties have access to shared EPR pairs, thus demonstrating the cryptographic power of this resource. First, we construct a one-shot (i.e., single message) string oblivious transfer (OT) protocol with random receiver bit in the shared EPR pairs model, assuming the (sub-exponential) hardness of LWE. Building on this, we show that {\em secure teleportation through quantum channels} is possible. Specifically, given the description of any quantum operation $Q$, a sender with (quantum) input $\rho$ can send a single classical message that securely transmits $Q(\rho)$ to a receiver. That is, we realize an ideal quantum channel that takes input $\rho$ from the sender and provably delivers $Q(\rho)$ to the receiver without revealing any other information. This immediately gives a number of applications in the shared EPR pairs model: (1) non-interactive secure computation of unidirectional \emph{classical} randomized functionalities, (2) NIZK for QMA from standard (sub-exponential) hardness assumptions, and (3) a non-interactive \emph{zero-knowledge} state synthesis protocol. Next, we construct a two-round (round-optimal) secure multiparty computation protocol for classical functionalities in the shared EPR pairs model that is \emph{unconditionally-secure} in the (quantum-accessible) random oracle model.
papers.title_zh: 共享EPR对的安全计算(或:如何在零知识下传送)
papers.abstract_zh: 发送方能否在不知道接收到哪个字符串的情况下，以非交互方式将两个字符串中的一个发送给接收方？是否存在只使用(黑盒)对称密钥原语的最小交互安全多方计算？我们在一个模型中为这些问题提供了肯定的答案，在该模型中，各方可以访问共享的EPR对，从而展示了这种资源的加密能力。首先，我们在共享EPR对模型中构造了一个具有随机接收比特的一次性(即单消息)字符串不经意传输(ot)协议，假设该协议具有LWE(次指数)硬度。在此基础上，我们证明了{\em通过量子通道安全传送}是可能的。具体来说，给定任何量子操作$Q$的描述，具有(quantum)输入$\rho$的发送者可以发送单个经典消息，该消息将$Q(\rho)$安全地传输到接收者。也就是说，我们实现了一个理想的量子信道，它从发送方获取输入$\rho$，并可证明地将$Q(\rho)$传递给接收方，而不透露任何其他信息。这立即给出了共享EPR对模型中的许多应用:(1)单向随机化功能的非交互式安全计算，(2)来自标准(亚指数)硬度假设的QMA的NIZK，以及(3)非交互式零知识状态合成协议。接下来，我们为共享EPR对模型中的经典功能构造了一个两轮(轮最优)安全多方计算协议，该协议在(量子可访问)随机预言模型中是无条件安全的。

papers.title: Compact Lattice Gadget and Its Applications to Hash-and-Sign Signatures
papers.authors: Yang Yu, Huiwen Jia, Xiaoyun Wang
papers.abstract: This work aims to improve the practicality of gadget-based cryptosystems, with a focus on hash-and-sign signatures. To this end, we develop a compact gadget framework in which the used gadget is a square matrix instead of the short and fat one used in previous constructions. To work with this compact gadget, we devise a specialized gadget sampler, called semi-random sampler, to compute the approximate preimage. It first deterministically computes the error and then randomly samples the preimage. We show that for uniformly random targets, the preimage and error distributions are simulatable without knowing the trapdoor. This ensures the security of the signature applications. Compared to the Gaussian-distributed errors in previous algorithms, the deterministic errors have a smaller size, which lead to a substantial gain in security and enables a practically working instantiation. As the applications, we present two practically efficient gadget-based signature schemes based on NTRU and Ring-LWE respectively. The NTRU-based scheme offers comparable efficiency to Falcon and Mitaka and a simple implementation without the need of generating the NTRU trapdoor. The LWE-based scheme also achieves a desirable overall performance. It not only greatly outperforms the state-of-the-art LWE-based hash-and-sign signatures, but also has an even smaller size than the LWE-based Fiat-Shamir signature scheme Dilithium. These results fill the long-term gap in practical gadget-based signatures.
papers.title_zh: 紧致格工具及其在哈希签名中的应用
papers.abstract_zh: 这项工作旨在提高基于gadget的密码系统的实用性，重点是哈希和签名。为此，我们开发了一个紧凑的小工具框架，其中使用的小工具是一个正方形矩阵，而不是以前构造中使用的又短又胖的矩阵。为了使用这个紧凑的小工具，我们设计了一个专门的小工具采样器，称为半随机采样器，来计算近似的原像。它首先确定性地计算误差，然后随机采样原像。我们表明，对于均匀随机目标，原像和误差分布是可以模拟的，而不需要知道陷门。这确保了签名应用的安全性。与先前算法中的高斯分布误差相比，确定性误差具有更小的大小，这导致安全性的显著提高，并且使得实际工作的实例化成为可能。作为应用，我们分别基于NTRU和环LWE提出了两个实用有效的基于小工具的签名方案。基于NTRU的方案提供了与Falcon和Mitaka相当的效率，并且实现简单，不需要生成NTRU陷门。基于LWE的方案也实现了期望的整体性能。它不仅大大优于当前最先进的基于LWE的散列签名方案，而且比基于LWE的Fiat-Shamir签名方案Dilithium更小。这些结果填补了基于小工具的实用签名的长期空白。

papers.title: Cuckoo Hashing in Cryptography: Optimal Parameters, Robustness and Applications
papers.authors: Kevin Yeo
papers.abstract: Cuckoo hashing is a powerful primitive that enables storing items using small space with efficient querying. At a high level, cuckoo hashing maps $n$ items into $b$ entries storing at most $\ell$ items such that each item is placed into one of $k$ randomly chosen entries. Additionally, there is an overflow stash that can store at most $s$ items. Many cryptographic primitives rely upon cuckoo hashing to privately embed and query data where it is integral to ensure small failure probability when constructing cuckoo hashing tables as it directly relates to the privacy guarantees. As our main result, we present a more query-efficient cuckoo hashing construction using more hash functions. For construction failure probability $\epsilon$, the query overhead of our scheme is $O(1 + \sqrt{\log(1/\epsilon)/\log n})$. Our scheme has quadratically smaller query overhead than prior works for any target failure probability $\epsilon$. We also prove lower bounds matching our construction. Our improvements come from a new understanding of the locality of cuckoo hashing failures for small sets of items. We also initiate the study of robust cuckoo hashing where the input set may be chosen with knowledge of the hash functions. We present a cuckoo hashing scheme using more hash functions with query overhead $\tilde{O}(\log \lambda)$ that is robust against poly$(\lambda)$ adversaries. Furthermore, we present lower bounds showing that this construction is tight and that extending previous approaches of large stashes or entries cannot obtain robustness except with $\Omega(n)$ query overhead. As applications of our results, we obtain improved constructions for batch codes and PIR. In particular, we present the most efficient explicit batch code and blackbox reduction from single-query PIR to batch PIR.
papers.title_zh: 密码学中的布谷鸟散列法:最佳参数、鲁棒性和应用
papers.abstract_zh: Cuckoo hashing是一个强大的原语，支持使用小空间存储项目，并提供高效的查询。在高层次上，cuckoo散列将$n$个条目映射到$b$个条目中，最多存储$ ell $个条目，这样每个条目被放入$k$个随机选择的条目中的一个。此外，还有一个最多可以储存$s$物品的溢出仓库。许多密码原语依赖于cuckoo散列来秘密地嵌入和查询数据，其中它是不可或缺的，以确保在构造cuckoo散列表时的小失败概率，因为它直接关系到隐私保证。作为我们的主要结果，我们提出了一个使用更多散列函数的查询效率更高的cuckoo散列结构。对于构造失败概率$\epsilon$，我们方案的查询开销是$ O(1+\ sqrt { \ log(1/\ epsilon)/\ log n })$。对于任何目标失败概率＄\ epsilon ＄,我们的方案具有比先前的工作小二倍的查询开销。我们还证明了下界匹配我们的建设。我们的改进来自于对小项目集的cuckoo散列失败的局部性的新理解。我们也开始研究健壮的cuckoo散列法，其中输入集可以用散列函数的知识来选择。我们提出了一种使用更多散列函数的cuckoo散列方案，其查询开销为$\tilde{O}(\log \lambda)$对poly$(\lambda)$敌手是鲁棒的。此外，我们给出了下界，表明这种构造是紧密的，并且扩展先前的大型存储或条目的方法不能获得鲁棒性，除非具有$\Omega(n)$查询开销。作为我们结果的应用，我们得到了批码和PIR的改进构造。特别地，我们提出了从单查询PIR到批处理PIR的最有效的显式批处理代码和黑盒缩减。

papers.title: Correlated Pseudorandomness from the Hardness of Quasi-Abelian Decoding
papers.authors: Maxime Bombar, Geoffroy Couteau, Alain Couvreur, Clément Ducros
papers.abstract: Secure computation often benefits from the use of correlated randomness to achieve fast, non-cryptographic online protocols. A recent paradigm put forth by Boyle $\textit{et al.}$ (CCS 2018, Crypto 2019) showed how pseudorandom correlation generators (PCG) can be used to generate large amounts of useful forms of correlated (pseudo)randomness, using minimal interactions followed solely by local computations, yielding silent secure two-party computation protocols (protocols where the preprocessing phase requires almost no communication). An additional property called programmability allows to extend this to build N-party protocols. However, known constructions for programmable PCG's can only produce OLE's over large fields, and use rather new splittable Ring-LPN assumption. In this work, we overcome both limitations. To this end, we introduce the quasi-abelian syndrome decoding problem (QA-SD), a family of assumptions which generalises the well-established quasi-cyclic syndrome decoding assumption. Building upon QA-SD, we construct new programmable PCG's for OLE's over any field $\mathbb{F}_q$ with $q>2$. Our analysis also sheds light on the security of the ring-LPN assumption used in Boyle $\textit{et al.}$ (Crypto 2020). Using our new PCG's, we obtain the first efficient N-party silent secure computation protocols for computing general arithmetic circuit over $\mathbb{F}_q$ for any $q>2$.
papers.title_zh: 从准阿贝尔解码的困难性看相关伪随机性
papers.abstract_zh: 安全计算通常受益于相关随机性的使用，以实现快速、非加密的在线协议。Boyle $\textit{et al.}$ (CCS 2018，Crypto 2019)最近提出的一个范例显示了如何使用伪随机相关发生器(PCG)来生成大量有用形式的相关(伪)随机性，使用最少的交互，然后只进行本地计算，产生无声的安全双方计算协议(预处理阶段几乎不需要通信的协议)。称为可编程性的附加属性允许扩展它来构建多方协议。然而，已知的可编程PCG的结构只能在大的域上产生OLE，并且使用相当新的可分裂环-LPN假设。在这项工作中，我们克服了这两个限制。为此，我们引入了准阿贝尔伴随式解码问题(QA-SD)，这是一个假设族，它概括了公认的准循环伴随式解码假设。在QA-SD的基础上，我们为任何域$\mathbb{F}_q$上的OLE构造了新的可编程PCG，其中$q>2$。我们的分析还揭示了Boyle $ \ textit { et al . } $(Crypto 2020)中使用的ring-LPN假设的安全性。利用我们的新PCG，我们得到了第一个有效的N方静默安全计算协议，用于计算＄\ mathbb { F } _ q＄上的一般算术电路，其中任意＄q > 2＄。
